purpose: Highlight the importance and elements of an authentication strategy in the context of increasing digitization.
title: Due to increasing digitization an authentication strategy is increasingly important to balance cost, customer experience, and sturdiness of technology
reasoning_strategy: Comparison between goals and required elements.

content_zones.right: Required elements of future authentication strategies

tables.description: Comparison of current goals and future elements of authentication strategies
headers: Required elements of future authentication strategies

cells: Mitigate account take-over attacks and revenue losses
Increase usage/preference due to enhanced customer experience and security
Achieve economies of scale through standardization for all channels and interactions
Increase payment volume with reduced false declines
Reduce operational cost with less customer service calls
Actively authenticate users as needed with biometrics or methods

Layered approach: Technology & process
Layering of technology throughout the account lifecycle and across customer touchpoints will be critical to reducing false positive rates, while remaining as passive as possible to the customer

Public information: Use with caution
The future of authentication will consist of a more passive approach using non-public data, minimizing false positives, but also reducing customer interaction to minimize the risk of a negative customer experience

Device: Future of authentication
The mobile device will be leveraged as an important channel for authentication across touchpoints, by providing a host of opportunities to make authentication more effective; opt-in must be managed to facilitate success
